title: Best Loadouts In Black Ops 7
description: By     S.E. Doster   on November 18, 2025 at 11:13AM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases...
body:
By 
    S.E. Doster
   on November 18, 2025 at 11:13AM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is live now, and the game is packed with 30 weapons and tons of attachments to use. There are plenty of weapon builds that can be created in the Gunsmith, but this guide will recommend some of the best options to use in Black Ops 7 multiplayer.Black Ops 7's new Gunsmith addition is the weapon build code feature. Weapon build codes are unique to each weapon and a specific set of attachments, making it easy to share and receive custom weapon builds. We'll list the attachments for each build, but also include the unique weapon code for you to easily enter and use.Simply hit L3 to pull up your options while you are in the Gunsmith. This will let you import a weapon build code to use. Additionally, any weapon builds you create in the Gunsmith will have a code generated at the bottom-left corner of your screen.If you're on console, we have a recommended settings guide to help you get the most out of Black Ops 7's multiplayer and other modes. Our Black Ops 7 perk and Wildcard guide can be found here.M15 Mod 0The M15 Mod 0 is an easy-to-handle assault rifle perfect for when you're just getting started. It's also very powerful to use. The recommended attachments will make this even easier to handle by reducing the gun's recoil, improving the damage range, and more.Recommended M15 Mod attachments:Optic: LTI MiniMuzzle: VAS 5.56 SuppressorBarrel: 16.5" FusionUnderbarrel: Ironhold AngleRear Grip: Hexcut GripBuild code: A01-5XP7V-4KFH1-1MXR-17The MXR-17 is another strong assault rifle contender in Black Ops 7. The recommended attachments will boost the gun's damage range, increase ammo count, speed up the aim-down-sight speed, and help reduce recoil.Recommended MXR-17 attachments:Muzzle: Greaves TI-762Barrel: Redwell 90 CompensatorUnderbarrel: Lateral PrecisionMagazine: Vault Extended MagRear Grip: Aril Assail GripBuild code: A03-6U1FL-TJ11AK-27There's no shortage of long-range powerhouses in Black Ops 7, and the AK-27 assault rifle is another solid pick for medium- to long-range combat. The recommended attachments will increase the gun's damage range, boost ammo count, and help you reduce the weapon's recoil.Recommended AK-27 attachments:Muzzle: SWF-Tishna 11Barrel: 18.2" Vostok Extended BarrelUnderbarrel: Lateral PrecisionRear Grip: Garin AdvanceFire Mod: Buffer SpringsBuild code: A02-6U4K6-SQ51M8A1If you want a burst-fire weapon with high precision, the M8A1 marksman rifle is a great pick for multiplayer. This is a powerful and very accurate gun for medium- to long-range combat. The recommended attachments will improve accuracy, boost your ammo count, and reduce recoil.Recommended M8A1 attachments:Optic: Lethal Tools ELOMuzzle: Vas 5.56 SuppressorUnderbarrel: Force Stabilizer HandstopMagazine: Sentinel Extended MagRear Grip: G7 Launch GripBuild code: M01-5XMZH-ZNHY1-1Dravec 45The Dravec 45 submachine gun is one of the best close-range weapons in Black Ops 7. The Dravec 45 is fairly easy to use, and the recommended attachments will help improve the bullet velocity, boost your ammo count, and reduce recoil.Recommended Dravec 45 attachments:Muzzle: Bowen .45 SuppressorBarrel: 19" EAM HorizonMagazine: Gator Extended MagRear Grip: Herald ZI GripFire Mod: Accelerated Recoil SystemBuild code: S04-CYGM8-G51Ryden 45KWhile it's not quite as fast-firing as the Dravec 45, the Ryden 45K is another powerful submachine gun for close-range fights. The recommended attachments will increase the damage range, boost your ammo count, and reduce recoil. If you're still struggling with recoil on this gun, you can always swap the recommended rear grip attachment for the Skeletonized Grip for further recoil control.Recommended Ryden 45K attachments:Muzzle: Bowen .45 SuppressorBarrel: 12" Vienna BarrelMagazine: Torch 40 Round MagRear Grip: Eruption GripFire Mod: Recoil Sync UnitBuild code: S01-A2L6U-D51Velox 5.7If you're not planning on running the Overkill wildcard and need a strong secondary, the Velox 5.7 is a three-round burst pistol that packs a punch. The recommended attachments will boost the gun's ammo count, increase the aim-down-sight speed, and help reduce the recoil.Recommended Velox 5.7 attachments:Optic: LTI MiniMuzzle: Greaves Covert-SMagazine: Draco Reserve Extended IIRear Grip: Quick Spine GripFire Mod: Accelerated Recoil SystemBuild code: P02-5XHCH-KL6F5-1

title: Battlefield 6 California Resistance Event Pass: All Free And Paid Rewards To Unlock
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                Season 1 of Battlefield 6 continues to expand with the new...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Season 1 of Battlefield 6 continues to expand with the new California Resistance update. This content patch includes the new Eastwood multiplayer map and an event pass you can complete to unlock more rewards. In this guide, we'll show you all the free and paid items you can unlock in this new event pass for California Resistance, including the game's new DB-12 shotgun.The California Resistance event pass is a bonus reward path separate from the game's Season 1 battle pass, but you'll still find it under the battle pass tab in the Battlefield 6 menus. This event pass includes 11 tiers of free and premium items to unlock, meaning you'll need to purchase the season's premium battle pass to earn them all. However, the DB-12 shotgun is one of the six free rewards you can unlock.You level up the California Resistance event pass by earning battle pass points, and this will level up alongside your active path in the Season 1 battle pass. Points are earned by completing weekly challenges and earning XP. You reach a new reward tier for every 10 battle pass points you earn.The pass is available to complete between now and the launch of Season 1's Winter Offensive update on December 9.The full list of rewards can be found below, including a new operator skin, vehicle camo, XP boosters, the new shotgun, and more.

title: Monster Hunter Is Magic: The Gathering's Next Secret Lair Superdrop, See All The Cards
description: By     Jason Fanelli   on November 18, 2025 at 10:06AM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from...
body:
By 
    Jason Fanelli
   on November 18, 2025 at 10:06AM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Wizards of the Coast and Capcom have come together to bring many of Monster Hunter's massive monsters to Magic: The Gathering in a new Secret Lair superdrop. The drop will begin December 1 at 9 AM PT / 12 PM ET, and will run until December 21 while supplies last. Images of each card in the superdrop are in the gallery below.Each drop includes multiple reprints from Magic's history, but with new unique art showcasing the monsters and hunters of Capcom's fan-favorite franchise. 20 cards total will be available in the superdrop, including a special variant of Sol Ring for those who purchase one of the drop's bundles.Individual drops will be priced at $30 for non-foil and $40 for foil, and the drop will also include multiple bundles. One such bundle, the Amped State Surge Foil, will feature all four drops in a special surge foil treatment for $240. The surge foil variants are only available in the Amped State bundle.Each drop will be available in both English and Japanese, and each will be available separately and as part of a bundle with other drops. Cards within the drops will be available in three variants: non-foil, foil, and the previously-mentioned special surge foil edition.The four drops are as follows:Secret Lair x Monster Hunter - The HuntCrimson Moonlight (reprint of Blind Obedience)Kushala Daora's Fury (reprint of Snap)Song of the Barbarous Beast (reprint of Village Rites)The Rage of Yian Garuga (reprint of Mizzium Mortars)Tooth and NailSecret Lair x Monster Hunter - The HuntersDual-Bladed Hunter (reprint of Grand Abolisher)Hero of Hoarfrost Reach (reprint of Archaeomancer)Nargacuga Stalker (reprint of Grim Haruspex)Bherna Huntmaster (reprint of Imperial Recruiter)Champion of Kotoko (reprint of Champion of Lambholt)Secret Lair x Monster Hunter - The Monsters ILagiacrus, Lord of the Seas (reprint of Nezahal, Primal Tide)Rathalos, King of the Skies (reprint of Drakuseth, Maw of Flames)Fatalis, the Black Dragon (reprint of Ziatora, the Incinerator)Nergigante, Herald of Destruction (reprint of Vaevictis Asmadi, the Dire)Zinogre, Lord of Lightning (reprint of Sarulf, Realm Eater)Secret Lair x Monster Hunter - The Monsters IIGore Magala, Dark Eclipse (reprint of Razaketh, the Foulblooded)Brachydios, Brutish Indigo (reprint of Kalamax, the Stormsire)Nargacuga, Ever-Present Shadow (reprint of Wasitora, Nekoru Queen)Velkhana, Silver Sovereign (reprint of Amareth, the Lustrous)Sol Ring (bonus card with purchase of any bundle)The Hunt - Crimson Moonlight (reprint of Blind Obedience)The Hunt - Kushala Daora's Fury (reprint of Snap)The Hunt - Song of the Barbarous Beast (reprint of Village Rites)The Hunt - The Rage of Yian Garuga (reprint of Mizzium Mortars)The Hunt - Tooth and NailThe Hunters - Dual-Bladed Hunter (reprint of Grand Abolisher)The Hunters - Hero of Hoarfrost Reach (reprint of Archaeomancer)The Hunters - Nargacuga Stalker (reprint of Grim Haruspex)The Hunters - Bherna Huntmaster (reprint of Imperial Recruiter)The Hunters - Champion of Kotoko (reprint of Champion of Lambholt)The Monsters - Lagiacrus, Lord of the Seas (reprint of Nezahal, Primal Tide)The Monsters - Rathalos, King of the Skies (reprint of Drakuseth, Maw of Flames)The Monsters - Fatalis, the Black Dragon (reprint of Ziatora, the Incinerator)The Monsters - Nergigante, Herald of Destruction (reprint of Vaevictis Asmadi, the Dire)The Monsters - Zinogre, Lord of Lightning (reprint of Sarulf, Realm Eater)The Monsters II - Gore Magala, Dark Eclipse (reprint of Razaketh, the Foulblooded)The Monsters II - Brachydios, Brutish Indigo (reprint of Kalamax, the Stormsire)The Monsters II - Nargacuga, Ever-Present Shadow (reprint of Wasitora, Nekoru Queen)The Monsters II - Velkhana, Silver Sovereign (reprint of Amareth, the Lustrous)
